description: Retrospective permission for the installation of three air-conditioning units within the front lightwell and four air-conditioning units to the rear elevation including installation of acoustic enclosures.
decision_conditions:
The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

<p>Noise from the air conditioning units, together with any associated ancillary equipment shall prevent the transmission of noise and vibration into neighbouring premises. The noise level from all plant and machinery included in the approved development shall at all times remain 5dB(A) below background levels when measured at any nearby residential window or other sensitive receptor. </p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that occupiers of neighbouring premises do not suffer a loss of amenity by reason of noise nuisance and other excess noise.</p>

<p>The development hereby approved shall cease within three months of the date of failure to meet any one of the requirements set out in (i) to (iv) below:-</p><p>i) Within three months of the date of this decision details of the following matters shall have been submitted for the written approval of the local planning authority which shall include a timetable for implementation.</p><p>a) Materials and detailed design of the acoustic enclosures to ensure compliance with the mitigation measure as set out within the Noise Impact Assessment prepared by Nova Acoustics and dated 18/01/2021.</p><p>ii) If within six months of the date of this decision the local planning authority refuse to approve the details or fail to give a decision and have not agreed in writing to an alternative period for a decision to be made, a valid appeal shall have been made to the Secretary of State.<br></p><p>iii) If an appeal is made in pursuance of (ii) above, that appeal shall have been finally determined and the submitted scheme shall have been approved by the Secretary of State. i</p><p>v) The approved scheme shall have been carried out and completed in accordance with the approved timetable.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that occupiers of neighbouring premises do not suffer a loss of amenity by reason of noise nuisance and other excess noise and to ensure a high standard of design is employed.&nbsp;</p>
